result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Christopher Ward

Case in court for status conference.  
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests resolution date. 
Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Oral No Contact Order with Home Depot Wauwatosa.

Defendant Marcus Christopher Ward appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Erica N Young appeared by video for Marcus Christopher Ward.  Attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Defense requests plea and sentencing hearing. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/19/2022@2p
